I'm gonna call out that there is some weird behaviour around which conditions cause banners to disappear, but I think that should be handled in a separate PR since a lot of it was actually already around.

Examples:

  • If you get the "stream doesn't exist" error and then update the stream name, it doesn't let you send the message unless you update the message text (already existing bug).
  • The "sending to resolved topic" error comes and goes as soon as the topic changes, but the "stream doesn't exist" error doesn't (might be a new issue -- edit: okay the banner removes at a different time currently which is when you type in the textbox).

I think it would be great to do an audit of this for some followups. Does that seem reasonable? Or should I include this in the current PR.
I think we don't want the PR to introduce any regressions, but we're fine with fixing existing bugs in a separate pass. @Tim Abbott does that sound right?

Maybe I need to make a doc with every banner, with how it appears and how it disappears. It's not a trivial question to answer, but it could be worth it to get all that information and make decisions from there?

By the way, seeing the screenshots reminds me that it would be great to get #19878 (PR #20562) taken care of. Since that PR has been hanging around for a while, does someone want to take over and rebase/finish it? (CC Aman (amanagr) )

Alya Abbott said:

I think we don't want the PR to introduce any regressions, but we're fine with fixing existing bugs in a separate pass. Tim Abbott does that sound right?

Yeah, that's correct.

Evy said:

I think it would be great to do an audit of this for some followups. Does that seem reasonable? Or should I include this in the current PR.

Yeah, I think it's pretty reasonable for the types of subtle, likely preexisting issues to be handled in a follow-up; this PR already has a lot of refactoring folded into it and I'd like us to actually get to integrate it.

Thanks, it's super helpful to see all these! These aren't exactly part of the issue, but could you make the following couple of changes while we're here?

  1. Add a # before the stream name in all the messages where we mention a stream. It'll be a good quick improvement while we're figuring out #19878. I think should have a pattern of avoiding referring to streams without a hash or more specific symbol.
  2. Add a period at the end of the sentence for all the banners that are missing it, for consistency.
  3. I think the main problem with the @-mention warning is that it's way too long. How about something like this?

Are you sure you want to send @-mention notifications to the 17 users subscribed to #stream? If not, please edit your message to remove the <strong>@{mention}</strong> mention.

The motivation is to hint that this is an org setting, not a Zulip limitation. You could change it if you are an admin, or ask an admin to do so.

The motivation is to hint that this is an org setting, not a Zulip limitation. You could change it if you are an admin, or ask an admin to do so.

I feel like the experience with it disabled is significantly better since you're always explicitly picking a topic and don't accidentally send to (no topic). I can imagine people seeing the banner and wanting to enable it early in their Zulip experience (because they want something like Slack) but then ending up with a worse experience in the end. I won't fight much more for this change, but that's what was motivating that comment.
